card.name: Cable
card.property: Response: After Cable defeats a side scheme, ready him. (Limit once per phase.)
"The battle may be won, but the war is far from over."

alternate.name: Nathan Summers
alternate.property: You may include player side schemes from any aspect in your deck. Soldier X — Setup: Search your deck and discard pile for a player side scheme and put it into play. (Shuffle.)

card.name: Bodyslide
card.property: Action: Change form. Each other player may change to the form you are in.

card.name: Mind Scan
card.property: Hero Action (thwart): Remove 3 threat from a scheme. Remove 1 additional threat from that scheme for each side scheme in the victory display.

card.name: Precognition
card.property: Hero Action: Look at the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is the number of side schemes in the victory display. You may discard 1 of those cards. Put the rest back in any order.

card.name: Telekinetic Blast
card.property: Hero Action (attack): Deal 6 damage to an enemy. Deal 1 additional damage to that enemy for each side scheme in the victory display.

card.name: Technovirus Purge
card.property: Victory 0. Characters other than Cable cannot remove threat from Technovirus Purge. While Technovirus Purge is in the victory display, Nathan Summers and Cable gain the [[PSIONIC]] trait and Cable gets +1 THW, +1 ATK, and +1 DEF.

card.name: Graymalkin
card.property: Response: After a side scheme is defeated, ready Graymalkin. Resource: Exhaust Graymalkin → generate a [energy] resource.
Cable's orbital base is operated by the sentient A.I. known as Professor.

card.name: Professor
card.property: Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust Professor → choose to either draw 1 card or search your deck and discard pile for a player side scheme and add it to your hand. (Shuffle.)
"I'm sorry, Wade. I'm afraid I can't do that."

card.name: Askani'son
card.property: Hero Response (thwart): After you defend against an enemy attack, exhaust Askani'son and spend a [energy] resource → remove threat from a scheme equal to your hero's THW.

card.name: Forced Amnesia
card.property: Hero Response: After a (non-permanent) side scheme is defeated, add Forced Amnesia and that side scheme to the victory display.

card.name: Plasma Rifle
card.property: Restricted. Hero Action (attack): Exhaust Plasma Rifle and spend a [physical] resource → deal 1 damage to an enemy for each side scheme in the victory display (to a maximum of 4). This attack gains ranged.

card.name: Telekinetic Force Field
card.property: Hero form only Hero Interrupt: When a friendly character would take any amount of damage, discard Telekinetic Force Field → prevent all of that damage.

card.name: Temporal Leap
card.property: Hero Interrupt: When the main scheme would be completed, remove this card from the game and put a side scheme from the victory display into play → move 4 threat from the main scheme to that side scheme.

card.name: Caliban
card.property: Response: After Caliban enters play, discard cards from the top of your deck until an [[X-FACTOR]], [[X-FORCE]], or [[X-MEN]] ally is discarded. Add that ally to your hand.

card.name: Fantomex
card.property: Response: After Fantomex enters play, search your deck and discard pile for E.V.A. and put it into play. (Shuffle.)
"E.V.A. is more than a vehicle. She's my partner. She's my mutation."

card.name: Sunspot
card.property: Response: After you play Sunspot from your hand, choose a player → deal 1 damage to the villain and each minion engaged with the chosen player for each [energy] resource used to pay for Sunspot.

card.name: Mission Planning
card.property: Play only if there is a side scheme in the victory display. Hero Action: Until the end of the phase, allies you control do not take consequential damage.

card.name: Call for Backup
card.property: Victory 0. When Defeated: Each player may search their deck and discard pile for an ally and put it into play. (Shuffle.)
"Blue team, rendezvous at my location!" — Bishop

card.name: Lock and Load
card.property: Victory 0. When Defeated: Each player may search their deck and discard pile for a [[WEAPON]] upgrade with a cost of 3 or less and put it into play. (Shuffle.)
"We'll need guns. Lots of guns." — Cable

card.name: Establish Perimeter
card.property: Victory 0. When Defeated: Give each identity a tough status card.
"Don't worry, kids. They won't get through me!" — Armor

card.name: E.V.A.
card.property: If Fantomex is not in play, discard E.V.A. Action: Exhause E.V.A. → choose: • Remove 1 threat from a scheme. • Deal 1 damage to an enemy. • Heal 1 damage from Fantomex.

card.name: Uncanny X-Force
card.property: Play under any player's control. Max 1 [[TEAM]] card per player. If each of your characters has the [[X-FORCE]] trait, each ally you control gets +1 THW and takes -1 consequential damage ([consequential]) after thwarting a side scheme.

card.name: Mission Leader
card.property: Reduce the cost to play Mission Leader by 1 if your identity has the [[SOLDIER]] trait. Hero Response: After a side scheme is defeated, exhaust Mission Leader → each player draws 1 card.

card.name: Deadpool
card.property: Forced Interrupt: When Deadpool would be defeated by consequential damage, heal 3 damage from him instead. Add an acceleration token to the main scheme.
"...Cable? Not interested. I stream everything."

card.name: Deathlok
card.property: Hero Response: After Deathlok enters play, choose an upgrade in any player's discard pile with a cost of 1 or less that can be attached to Deathlok. Attach that upgrade to Deathlok.

card.name: Frenemies
card.property: Team-Up (Cable and Deadpool). Max 1 per deck. Hero Action (thwart): Deal 1 damage each to Cable and Deadpool. Remove 3 threat from a scheme and 3 threat from a different scheme.

card.name: Build Support
card.property: Victory 0. When Defeated: Each player may search their deck and discard pile for a support with a cost of 3 or less and put it into play. (Shuffle.)
"I've got just the thing." — Forge

card.name: The Power of the Mind
card.property: Double the number of resources this card generates while paying for a [[PSIONIC]] card.

card.name: Psimitar
card.property: Restricted. Hero Response (attack): After you play another [[PSIONIC]] card, exhaust Psimitar → deal 2 damage to an enemy.

card.name: Sidearm
card.property: Attach to an ally. Max 1 per ally. Attached ally gets +1 ATK and its attacks gain ranged.
"That gun is not nearly as dangerous as the man who wields it." — Cable

card.name: Domino
card.property: When counting resources on cards discarded from the top of the deck, count each printed [wild] icon twice. Action: Choose a card in your hand. Swap that card with the top card of your deck. (Limit once per round.)

alternate.name: Neena Thurman
alternate.property: Action: Choose a card in your hand. Swap that card with the top card of your discard pile. (Limit once per round.)

card.name: Diamondback
card.property: Action: Exhaust Diamondback, deal 1 damage to her, and discard the top card of your deck → deal 1 damage to each enemy for each resource icon discarded this way.

card.name: Outlaw
card.property: Interrupt: When Outlaw attacks, discard the top card of your deck → Outlaw gets +1 ATK for this attack for each resource icon discarded this way. Toughness.

card.name: A Good Workout
card.property: Hero Action (attack): Deal 4 damage to an enemy and discard the top card of your deck. For each resource icon discarded this way, deal 1 additional damage to an enemy.

card.name: Luck Be a Lady
card.property: Hero Action: Discard the top card of your deck and count the resources on it. For each resource counted this way, if it is a: [energy] - Heal 2 damage from a character. [mental] - Remove 2 threat from a scheme. [physical] - Deal 3 damage to an enemy. [wild] - Choose 1 of the above.

card.name: Right Place, Right Time
card.property: Hero Action (thwart): Remove 3 threat from a scheme and discard the top card of your deck. For each resource icon discarded this way, remove 1 additional threat from that scheme.

card.name: Jackpot!
card.property: Response: After this card is discarded from the top of your deck, shuffle it back into your deck.

card.name: Pip the Pug
card.property: Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust Pip the Pug → put 1 Domino or [[POSSE]] card from your discard pile on top of your deck.
"Did you just piddle on me, you nasty little sausage!" — Domino

card.name: The Painted Lady
card.property: Response: After you discard a card from the top of the deck, attach that card facedown here (to a maximum of 3). Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust The Painted Lady → add 1 card attached here to your hand.

card.name: Domino's Pistol
card.property: Restricted. Hero Action (attack): Exhaust Domino's Pistol, choose an enemy, and discard the top card of your deck → deal 1 damage to that enemy for each resource icon discarded this way. This attack gains ranged.

card.name: Lucky and Good
card.property: Hero Interrupt (defense): When a boost card is turned faceup during an attack against you, exhaust Lucky and Good → cancel that card's boost icons and "Boost" ability. Give the attacking enemy another boost card for this attack.

card.name: Lucky Break
card.property: Hero Interrupt: When you reveal an encounter card, discard Lucky Break → cancel the effects of that card and discard it. Reveal another card from the encounter deck.

card.name: Probability Field
card.property: Interrupt: When you use a basic power, discard the top card of your deck → you get +1 to that power for this use for each resource icon discarded this way.

card.name: Feral
card.property: "I have caught the prey's scent."

card.name: Team Investigation
card.property: Alliance. (The players can pay this card's costs as a group.) Hero Action: Remove 3[per_hero] threat from a side scheme.
"If I may coin a phrase, many minds make light work." — Beast

card.name: Take Out the Guards
card.property: Victory 0. When Defeated: Each player may discard 1 non-[[ELITE]] minion from play.
"Nighty night, bub." — Wolverine

card.name: Atlas Bear
card.property: Action: Exhaust Atlas Bear → look at the top card of a player deck. If that card is an event, you may deal 1 damage to Atlas Bear to add that card to its owner's hand.

card.name: White Fox
card.property: Response: After White Fox is discarded from the top of your deck, put her into play under your control.
"I am the last of my kind. I am the last kumiho!"

card.name: The Posse
card.property: Max 1 per deck. Play only if you control at least 3 characters with the [[POSSE]] trait. Hero Action: Heal 1 damage from each [[POSSE]] character and ready them.

card.name: Superpower Training
card.property: Victory 0. When Defeated: Each player may search their deck and discard pile for an identity-specific upgrade and put it into play. (Shuffle.)
"Class is in session." — Charles Xavier

card.name: Digging Deep
card.property: Response: After this card is discarded from the top of your deck, add it to your hand.

card.name: Sharpshooter
card.property: Max 1 per player. Hero Interrupt: When you make a ranged attack, discard the top card of your deck → this attack deals 1 additional damage for each resource icon discarded this way.

card.name: Assemble the Team
card.property: This scheme does not count against the player side scheme limit. When Defeated: Flip this card and put Team Assembled into play. (The ability on Team Assembled allows each player to play an ally from their deck for free.)

alternate.name: Team Assembled
alternate.property: Enters play with 1 assembly counter on it. Action: Remove 1 assembly counter from here → each player may search their deck and discard pile for an ally with a printed cost of 3 or less and put it into play. (Any player can do this.)

card.name: Establish Safehouse
card.property: This scheme does not count against the player side scheme limit. When Defeated: Flip this card and put Safehouse Established into play. (The ability on Safehouse Established gains the players the Safehouse support card.)

alternate.name: Safehouse Established
alternate.property: Enters play with 1 safehouse counter on it. Action: Remove 1 safehouse counter from here → the first player puts the Safehouse support into play under their control. (Safehouse is a campaign card.)

card.name: Gear Up
card.property: This scheme does not count against the player side scheme limit. When Defeated: Flip this card and put Geared Up into play. (The ability on Geared Up gains each player a Pouches resource card.)

alternate.name: Geared Up
alternate.property: Enters play with 1 pouch counter on it. Action: Remove 1 pouch counter from here → each player shuffles 1 copy of the Pouches resource card into their deck. (Pouches is a campaign card.)

card.name: Mission Prep
card.property: This scheme does not count against the player side scheme limit. When Defeated: Flip this card and put Mission Prepped into play. (The ability on Mission Prepped allows each player to play an upgrade from their deck for free.)

alternate.name: Mission Prepped
alternate.property: Enters play with 1 prep counter on it. Action: Remove 1 prep counter from here → each player searches their deck and discard pile for 1 upgrade with a printed cost of 2 or less and puts it into play. (Any player can do this.)

card.name: Practice Maneuvers
card.property: This scheme does not count against the player side scheme limit. When Defeated: Flip this card and put Practiced Maneuvers into play. (The ability on Practiced Maneuvers provides the players a permanent discount on high-cost event cards.)

alternate.name: Practiced Maneuvers
alternate.property: Reduce the cost to play each event with a printed cost of 3 or more by 1.
"Last one through the course does the laundry for a month!" — Sunspot

card.name: Prepare Defenses
card.property: This scheme does not count against the player side scheme limit. When Defeated: Flip this card and put Prepared Defenses into play. (The ability on Prepared Defenses gains each player a permanent +1 DEF and retaliate 1.)

alternate.name: Prepared Defenses
alternate.property: Each hero gets +1 DEF and gains retaliate 1.
"We've got incoming!" "They can each my high-velocity diamond shards." — Rockslide and Bling!

card.name: Pouches
card.property: "I can never remember where I put anything." — Deadpool

card.name: Safehouse
card.property: Alter-Ego Action: Choose: • Heal 2 damage from your identity. • Draw 1 card. Any player may trigger this ability. (Limit once per round per player.)

card.name: Hope Summers
card.property: Hope Summers gains each [[TRAIT]] on your identity. Response: After you play Hope Summers from your hand, search your deck for a [[SUPERPOWER]] card and add it to your hand. (Shuffle.)

card.name: Technovirus Resurgence
card.property: Give to the Nathan Summers player. When Revealed: Search your deck, discard pile, hand, and victory display for Technovirus Purge and put it into play. (Shuffle.) Attach this card to Technovirus Purge. If you cannot, discard this card and deal yourself 1 facedown encounter card.

card.name: Stryfe
card.property: Villainous. Forced Interrupt: When a player plays a [[PSIONIC]] event, cancel the effects of that event and deal 1 damage to Stryfe.
"Regardless of who is the clone, Cable, it is my power that is superior!"

card.name: Back to the Future
card.property: The Cable player cannot remove threat from schemes other than Back to the Future. Other players cannot remove threat from Back to the Future. The Cable player cannot damage enemies not engaged with them. Other players cannot damage minions engaged with the Cable player.

card.name: Telekinetic Force Field
card.property: Attach to Stryfe. Otherwise, attach to the villain. Forced Interrupt: When attached character would take any amount of damage, prevent that damage. If 2 or more damage was prevented this way, discard this card. Attach this card to the activating enemy.

card.name: Mind Scan
card.property: When Revealed: Place 2 threat on the main scheme. Place 1 additional threat on the main scheme for each side scheme in the victory display. You are confused.

card.name: Telekinetic Blast
card.property: When Revealed: Take 2 damage. Take 1 additional damage for each side scheme in the victory display. You are stunned.

card.name: Memories of Armageddon
card.property: Give to the Neena Thurman player. Treat your identity's printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[TRAITS]]). Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust your identity → discard Memories of Armageddon.
As a child, Neena was used as a lab rat in the super-soldier program known as Project Armageddon.

card.name: Topaz
card.property: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck, discard pile, and set aside area for 1 copy of Superpower Feedback and attach it to your identity. (Shuffle.) (Domino's nemesis minion.)
Topaz is able to affect other mutants' abilities, either amplifying them or nullifying them.

card.name: Not My Lucky Day
card.property: When Revealed: Each player must either take 1 damage or place 2 threat here.
Domino is having a terrible, horrible, no good, very bad day.

card.name: Prototype
card.property: When Revealed: Place luck counters on Prototype equal to the amount of damage your identity has sustained.
Domino's good luck is Prototype's misfortune, and her suffering strengthens him.

card.name: Superpower Feedback
card.property: Attach to your identity. Forced Response: After you resolve an ability on your identity or an identity-specific card, take 1 damage. Alter-Ego Action: Discard 1 identity-specific card from your hand → discard this card.

card.name: Arclight
card.property: Forced Interrupt: When Arclight attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Confuse a character you control. • Arclight gets +2 ATK for this attack.

alternate.name: Arclight
alternate.property: Forced Interrupt: When Arclight attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Confuse the character you control with the highest THW. • Arclight gets +2 ATK for this attack.

card.name: Blockbuster
card.property: Forced Interrupt: When Blockbuster attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Give Blockbuster a tough status card. • Blockbuster gets +2 ATK for this attack.

alternate.name: Blockbuster
alternate.property: Forced Interrupt: When Blockbuster attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Give Blockbuster a tough status card. • Blockbuster gets +2 ATK for this attack and this attack gains overkill.

card.name: Chimera
card.property: Forced Interrupt: When Chimera attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Spend a [mental] resource. • Chimera gets +2 ATK for this attack.

alternate.name: Chimera
alternate.property: Forced Interrupt: When Chimera attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Spend [mental][mental] resources. • Chimera gets +2 ATK for this attack.

card.name: Greycrow
card.property: Forced Interrupt: When Greycrow attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Discard the highest-cost card you control. • Greycrow gets +X ATK for this attack, where X is the printed cost of the highest-cost card you control.

alternate.name: Greycrow
alternate.property: Forced Interrupt: When Greycrow attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Discard each card you control with the highest cost. • Greycrow gets +X ATK for this attack, where X is the printed cost of the highest-cost card you control.

card.name: Harpoon
card.property: Forced Interrupt: When Harpoon attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Take 2 indirect damage. • Give Harpoon 1 additional facedown boost card for this attack.

alternate.name: Harpoon
alternate.property: Forced Interrupt: When Harpoon attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Take 3 indirect damage. • Give Harpoon 1 additional facedown boost card for this attack. This attack gains overkill.

card.name: Riptide
card.property: Forced Interrupt: When Riptide attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Place 2 threat on the main scheme and 1 threat on each side scheme. • Riptide gets +2 ATK for this attack.

alternate.name: Riptide
alternate.property: Forced Interrupt: When Riptide attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Place 3 threat on the main scheme and 1 threat on each side scheme. • Riptide gets +2 ATK for this attack and this attack gains ranged and piercing.

card.name: Vertigo
card.property: Forced Interrupt: When Vertigo attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Stun a character you control. • Vertigo gets +2 ATK for this attack.

alternate.name: Vertigo
alternate.property: Forced Interrupt: When Vertigo attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Stun the character you control with the highest ATK. • Vertigo gets +2 ATK for this attack.

alternate.name: Knock, Knock
alternate.property: [star] Forced Response: After resolving step one of the villain phase, place 1 knock counter here. If there are at least 3 knock counters here, advance to stage 2A. If there are 3 villains under Routed, the players win the game.

alternate.name: Mutant Massacre
alternate.property: Action: Exhaust a [[MORLOCK]] ally → shuffle Hide! from the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. If there are 3 villains under Routed, the players win the game. If this stage is completed or there are no Morlock allies in play, the players lose the game.

card.name: Morlock
card.property: Victory -1. Does not count against your ally limit. Card abilities cannot remove this ally from play. Forced Interrupt: When an enemy attacks you, it attacks a Morlock you control instead.

card.name: Hide!
card.property: Surge. When Revealed: Give 1 [[MORLOCK]] ally a tough status card. Give 1 [[MORLOCK]] ally a tough status card. Give the villain 1 additional boost card for this activation.

card.name: Routed
card.property: Standard Mode Only. Cards under here are not in play. Forced Response: After the villain is defeated, put it under here. Discard each minion that shares a title with the top villain of the villain deck. (That villain is in play.) The villain activates against each player in player order.

alternate.name: Routed
alternate.property: Expert Mode Only. Cards under here are not in play. The villain gains retaliate 1 for each card under here. Forced Response: After the villain is defeated, put it under here. Discard each minion that shares a title with the top villain of the villain deck. (That villain is in play.) The villain activates against each player in player order.

card.name: Bolstered by Wrath
card.property: Attach to the villain. Hero Action: Exhaust a character you control and spend X resources of any type, where X is the number of villains under Routed → discard this card. This card gets +X boost icons ([boost]), where X is the number of villains under Routed.

card.name: Pushed to the Limit
card.property: Attach to the villain. While there is exactly 1 villain under Routed, attached villain gains steady. While there are exactly 2 villains under Routed, attached villain gains stalwart. Hero Action: Attached villain attacks you → discard this card.

card.name: By Any Means
card.property: When Revealed: Place 1[per_hero] additional threat here for each villain under Routed.

card.name: In the Midst of Chaos
card.property: When Revealed: Place 1[per_hero] additional threat here for each villain under Routed.

card.name: Maraudin' Ain't Easy
card.property: When Revealed: Place 1[per_hero] additional threat here for each villain under Routed.

card.name: Territorial Control
card.property: Assault. (Basic thwarts against this scheme use ATK instead of THW.) When Revealed: Place 1[per_hero] additional threat here for each villain under Routed.

card.name: Back in Action
card.property: When Revealed: Give the villain a tough status card. Place threat on the main scheme equal to the number of villains under Routed. If you control a Morlock ally, choose to either deal 1 damage to it or spend 1 resource of any type.

card.name: Seek the Weak
card.property: When Revealed (Alter-Ego): This card gains surge. When Revealed (Hero): The villain attacks you. If there is at least 1 villain under Routed, this attack gains overkill. If this activation is an attack, it gains overkill.

card.name: Heavy Armament
card.property: Attach to the enemy with the highest ATK. Attached enemy gains retaliate 2. Hero Response: After you attack the attached enemy, spend 2 resources of the same type → discard this card.

card.name: Titanium Exoskeleton
card.property: Attach to the enemy with the fewest remaining hit points. Attached enemy cannot take more than 2 damage from a single attack. Hero Action: Choose to either spend 3 resources of any type or remove a confused or stunned status card from attached enemy → discard this card.

card.name: Inhibitor Collar
card.property: Attach to your identity. Treat your identity's printed text box as if it were blank (except for traits). Action: Choose to either exhaust a character you control or take 3 damage → discard this card. (Any player can do this.)

card.name: The Senator's Support
card.property: Hinder 1[per_hero]. When Defeated: The first player discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an attachment is discarded and reveals that card.
This kind of hardware isn't found on the black market. Someone high up in the U. S. government must be supplying it.

card.name: Arclight
card.property: Retaliate 1. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Arclight attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Confuse a character you control. • Arclight gets +2 ATK for this attack.

card.name: Blockbuster
card.property: Guard. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Blockbuster attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Give Blockbuster a tough status card. • Blockbuster gets +2 ATK for this attack.

card.name: Chimera
card.property: Patrol. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Chimera attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Spend a [mental] resource. • Chimera gets +2 ATK for this attack.

card.name: Greycrow
card.property: Retaliate 1. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Greycrow attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Discard the highest-cost card you control. • Greycrow gets +X ATK for this attack, where X is the printed cost of the highest-cost card you control.

card.name: Harpoon
card.property: Guard. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Harpoon attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Take 2 indirect damage. • Harpoon gets +2 ATK for this attack and this attack gains piercing.

card.name: Riptide
card.property: Patrol. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Riptide attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Place 2 threat on the main scheme and 1 threat on each side scheme. • Riptide gets +2 ATK for this attack.

card.name: Vertigo
card.property: Guard. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Vertigo attacks you or an ally you control, choose: • Stun a character you control. • Vertigo gets +2 ATK for this attack.

card.name: Mutant Slayers
card.property: Each [[MARAUDER]] minion gains quickstrike. When Revealed: Place 1 additional threat here for each character in play with 1 or more of the following traits: [[MUTANT]], [[X-FACTOR]], [[X-FORCE]], or [[X-MEN]].

card.name: Bound by Business
card.property: When Revealed: Discard cards from the encounter deck until a [[MARAUDER]] minion that does not share a title with a card in play is discarded. Put that minion into play engaged with you.

alternate.name: Gotta Get Away
alternate.property: Each [[MARAUDER]] minion gains steady. When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck for a [[MARAUDER]] minion and puts it into play engaged with them. (Shuffle.) If this stage is completed, the players lose the game.

alternate.name: Escaping with Hope
alternate.property: Each [[MARAUDER]] minion gains guard and steady. In expert mode, the villain gains steady. If the villain is defeated, the players win the game. If this stage is completed, the players lose the game.

card.name: Hope's Captor
card.property: Permanent. [star] Forced Interrupt: When the villain would attack you, if a [[MARAUDER]] minion is engaged with you, the villain schemes instead. Forced Interrupt: When the villain would be defeated, reset attached villain's hit points to its printed hit point value instead. Flip this card and reveal it.

alternate.name: Hope's Captor
alternate.property: Permanent. The villain gets +6[per_hero] hit points. When Revealed: Advance the main scheme to stage 2A. This effect cannot be canceled. [star] Forced Interrupt: When the villain would attack you, if a [[MARAUDER]] minion is engaged with you, the villain schemes instead.

card.name: Hidden in the Clutter
card.property: Attach to the enemy with the fewest remaining hit points. Forced Interrupt: When any amount of damage would be dealt to attached enemy, place it here instead. If there is at least 3 damage here, attached enemy attacks the player who dealt the damage just placed here. Then, discard this card.

card.name: Favored Weapon
card.property: Attach to Greycrow or Harpoon. Otherwise, attach to the [[MARAUDER]] enemy with the lowest ATK. [star] Attached enemy's attacks gain overkill, piercing, and ranged. Hero Response: After your hero defends against an attack from attached enemy and takes no damage → discard this card.

card.name: Bushwhack
card.property: When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[MARAUDER]] minion and puts that minion into play engaged with them. (Shuffle.)

card.name: Pure Force
card.property: While Blockbuster is in play, this scheme gains the crisis icon ([crisis]). While Chimera is in play, this scheme gains the amplify icon ([amplify]).

card.name: Dizzying Deeds
card.property: When Revealed: Exhaust a character you control. If the following enemies are in play: • Arclight — Stun a character you control. • Riptide — Take 3 indirect damage. • Vertigo — Confuse a character you control.

card.name: Tag Team
card.property: When Revealed: Choose: • Each [[MARAUDER]] minion engaged with you activates against you. • Discard 7 cards from the top of the encounter deck. Put the topmost [[MARAUDER]] minion in the encounter discard pile into play engaged with you.

card.name: Gorgeous George
card.property: Teamwork ([[NASTY BOY]]). [star] Forced Interrupt: When Gorgeous George attacks you, exhaust a character you control. Exhaust a character you control.

card.name: Hairbag
card.property: Surge. Teamwork ([[NASTY BOY]]). After this activation, shuffle Hairbag into the encounter deck.

card.name: Ramrod
card.property: Retaliate 1. Teamwork ([[NASTY BOY]]). [star] Ramrod's attacks gain piercing. If the villain is attacking, this attack gains piercing.

card.name: Ruckus
card.property: Teamwork ([[NASTY BOY]]). When Revealed: Stun each character you control. You are stunned.

card.name: Slab
card.property: Teamwork ([[NASTY BOY]]). Toughness. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Slab attacks, place 1 growth counter on him. Slab gets +1 ATK for each growth counter on him for this attack.

card.name: Get Nasty
card.property: Each minion gets +1 ATK. When Revealed: Place 1 threat here for each minion in play (2 threat instead for each [[NASTY BOY]]). Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[NASTY BOY]] minion and reveal it. (Shuffle.)

card.name: Juggernaut
card.property: Juggernaut gets +1 ATK for each momentum counter here. When Revealed: Place 1 momentum counter here. Give Juggernaut a tough status card.
"Ain't nothin'—ain't nobody—can beat me!"

card.name: Juggernaut
card.property: Juggernaut gets +1 ATK for each momentum counter here. When Revealed: Place 1 momentum counter here. If Juggernaut Exposed is in play, flip it. Otherwise, give Juggernaut a tough status card.

card.name: Juggernaut
card.property: Juggernaut gets +1 ATK for each momentum counter here. When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for Head of Steam and reveal it. (Shuffle.) If Juggernaut Exposed is in play, flip it. Otherwise, give Juggernaut a tough status card.

alternate.name: The Unstoppable Juggernaut
alternate.property: [star] Forced Interrupt: When this scheme would be completed, instead do each of the following: 1. Remove all threat from here. 2. If Juggernaut Exposed is in play, flip it. 3. Place 1 momentum counter on Juggernaut. 4. Juggernaut attacks each player in player order (even if they are in alter-ego form).

card.name: Juggernaut's Helmet
card.property: Permanent. Attach to Juggernaut. Juggernaut gains stalwart and his attacks gain overkill. Hero Action: Spend 3 resources of the same type → remove each momentum counter from Juggernaut. Flip this card.

alternate.name: Juggernaut Exposed
alternate.property: Permanent. Attach to Juggernaut. Juggernaut takes 1 additional damage from each card with a printed [mental] resource. [star] Forced Response: After Juggernaut schemes, place 1 momentum counter on Juggernaut. Flip this card.

card.name: Head of Steam
card.property: Juggernaut gains retaliate X, where X is the number of momentum counters on Juggernaut. When Revealed: Attach Head of Steam to Juggernaut and place 1 momentum counter on him. Hero Response: After Juggernaut attacks you, spend 1 resource for each damage dealt by that attack → discard this card.

card.name: Building Momentum
card.property: Hero Response: After you defend against an attack from Juggernaut, remove 1 threat from this scheme.

card.name: Breakthrough
card.property: When Revealed: Choose: • Take damage equal to Juggernaut's ATK. • Discard the highest-cost upgrade or support you control.
"Oh, yeah!" — Juggernaut

card.name: Flatten
card.property: When Revealed: Choose to either take damage equal to Juggernaut's ATK or place 1 momentum counter on him. Give Juggernaut a tough status card.

card.name: Ground Pound
card.property: When Revealed: The players as a group take indirect damage equal to Juggernaut's ATK. Take 1 indirect damage.

card.name: Trample
card.property: When Revealed (Alter-Ego): Take 2 indirect damage. When Revealed (Hero): Juggernaut attacks the ally with the fewest remaining hit points. Deal 1 damage to an ally you control.

card.name: Cyttorak's Exemplar
card.property: In expert mode, this card gains incite 1. When Revealed: If Juggernaut Exposed is in play, flip it and place 1 momentum counter on Juggernaut. Otherwise, place threat on the main scheme equal to Juggernaut's ATK.

card.name: Hope Summers
card.property: Setup. The first player controls Hope Summers. Hope Summers does not count against your ally limit. [star] Hope Summer's base THW and base ATK are equal to the THW and ATK of your hero. If Hope Summers leaves play, the players lose the game.

card.name: Captive Hope
card.property: Hope Summers cannot ready. When Revealed: Exhaust Hope Summers.
"Alright, alright. I know the deal," Hope grumbles to her captor. "This isn't my first time being captured, you know."

card.name: Black Tom Cassidy
card.property: Villainous. Black Tom Cassidy cannot take damage while Creeping Willow is in play. When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Creeping Willow and put it into play engaged with you. (Shuffle.)

card.name: Creeping Willow
card.property: Forced Response: After Creeping Willow attacks and damages a character, stun that character. Guard. Quickstrike. You are stunned.

card.name: Making Green
card.property: Hinder 2[per_hero]. Each copy of Creeping Willow gains surge.

card.name: A Sound Thrashing
card.property: When Revealed: Each copy of Creeping Willow attacks the player it is engaged with (even if that player is in alter-ego form). If you were not attacked this way, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Creeping Willow and reveal it. (Shuffle.)

card.name: Mister Sinister
card.property: Forced Response: After a status card is placed on Mister Sinister, place 1 threat on the main scheme.
"Visionary, savior, madman. It doesn't matter. I am SINISTER."

card.name: Mister Sinister
card.property: When Revealed: Place 1[per_hero] threat on the main scheme (2[per_hero] threat instead if Mister Sinister has fewer than 2 [[SUPERPOWER]] attachments). Forced Response: After a status card is placed on Mister Sinister, place 2 threat on the main scheme.

card.name: Mister Sinister
card.property: When Revealed: Place 2[per_hero] threat on the main scheme (3[per_hero] threat instead if Mister Sinister has fewer than 2 [[SUPERPOWER]] attachments). Forced Response: After a status card is placed on Mister Sinister, place 3 threat on the main scheme.

alternate.name: Sinister Intent
alternate.property: When Revealed: Remove 1 random stage 2 from the game. Then advance to a random stage 2A.
The secret laboratory hidden deep below the abandoned orphanage is filled with vats containing innocent mutants, subjects of Sinister's experiments.

alternate.name: Taking Off
alternate.property: When Revealed: Attach the Flight attachment to Mister Sinister and shuffle the rest of the Flight encounter set into the encounter deck. When Completed: Advance to the other stage 2A. If you cannot, advance to stage 3A.

alternate.name: Bulking Up
alternate.property: When Revealed: Attach the Super Strength attachment to Mister Sinister and shuffle the rest of the Super Strength encounter set into the encounter deck. When Completed: Advance to the other stage 2A. If you cannot, advance to stage 3A.

alternate.name: Focusing In
alternate.property: When Revealed: Attach the Telepathy attachment to Mister Sinister and shuffle the rest of the Telepathy encounter set into the encounter deck. When Completed: Advance to the other stage 2A. If you cannot, advance to stage 3A.

alternate.name: Sinister Ends
alternate.property: Forced Interrupt: When Mister Sinister attacks, he attacks Hope Summers instead. (Other characters may defend the attack.) If this stage is completed, the players lose the game.
"I should thank you," Sinister sneers. "You've done what my bumbling flunkies could not: You brought me Hope."

card.name: Sinister Disguise
card.property: Attach to Minister Sinister. Forced Interrupt: When a player would deal damage to Minister Sinister, that player may spend [mental][mental] resources. If they do not, they deal that damage to the friendly character with the fewest remaining hit points instead. Discard this card (whether the resources were spent or not).

card.name: Sinister Soldier
card.property: [star] Sinister Soldier gets +1 SCH and +1 ATK for each [[SUPERPOWER]] attachment on Minister Sinister. For this activation, Mister Sinister gets +1 SCH and +1 ATK for each [[SUPERPOWER]] attachment on him.

card.name: Teleported Away
card.property: Hinder 1[per_hero]. Mister Sinister cannot take damage. Forced Interrupt: When Mister Sinister would attack, he schemes instead.

card.name: Genetic Mastery
card.property: When Revealed: If Mister Sinister has the following traits: • [[AERIAL]] — Take 2 indirect damage. • [[BRUTE]] — Exhaust your identity. • [[PSIONIC]] — Place 2 threat on the main scheme.

card.name: Molecular Control
card.property: When Revealed: Give Mister Sinister a tough status card. If he has the [[BRUTE]] trait, he heals 4 damage. Give Mister Sinister a tough status card.

card.name: Sinister Schemes
card.property: When Revealed: Mister Sinister schemes. If he has the [[PSIONIC]] trait, you are confused. You are confused.

card.name: Sinister Strike
card.property: When Revealed (Alter-Ego): This card gains surge. When Revealed (Hero): Mister Sinister attacks you. If he has the [[AERIAL]] trait, you are stunned. You are stunned.

card.name: Flight
card.property: Setup. Attach to the villain. Permanent. Attached villain gains the [[AERIAL]] trait. [star] Attached villain's attacks gain overkill.

card.name: Aerial Bombardment
card.property: Attach to the villain. [star] Attached villain gets +1 ATK and ignores the retaliate keyword while attacking a non-[[AERIAL]] character. Hero Action: Exhaust your hero and spend [mental][mental] resources → discard this card.

card.name: Out of Reach
card.property: Attach to the villain. The villain cannot take damage unless the attacker or attack has the [[AERIAL]] trait, or the attack has ranged. Hero Action: Exhaust your hero and spend [energy][energy] resources → discard this card.

card.name: High Ground
card.property: When Revealed: Discard each tough status card from each friendly character. The players as a group take 2 indirect damage (4 indirect damage instead if the villain has the [[BRUTE]] trait). If the villain is attacking, this attack gains piercing.

card.name: Super Strength
card.property: Setup. Attach to the villain. Permanent. Attached villain gains the [[BRUTE]] trait and steady. (Steady characters require 2 status cards of the same type to be stunned or confused.)

card.name: Impervious
card.property: Attach to the villain. Reduce the amount of damage attached villain takes from each attack by 1. Hero Action: Spend [physical][physical] resources → give the villain a tough status card and discard this card.

card.name: Thrown Object
card.property: Attach to the villain. [star] Attached villain's attacks gain ranged. [star] Forced Response: After the villain attacks, discard this card.

card.name: "I'll Take That"
card.property: When Revealed: Discard the upgrade you control with the lowest cost (highest cost instead if the villain has the [[PSIONIC]] trait). If no upgrade was discarded this way, this card gains surge.

card.name: Telepathy
card.property: Setup. Attach to the villain. Permanent. Attached villain gains the [[PSIONIC]] trait and retaliate 1. (After this character is attacked, deal 1 damage to the attacking character.)

card.name: Manufactured Drama
card.property: Supports you control cannot ready. When Revealed: Exhaust each support you control. If no supports were exhausted this way, this card gains surge. Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust your identity and discard 1 card from the top of your deck for each support you control → discard this card.

card.name: Sowing Discord
card.property: Allies you control cannot ready. When Revealed: Exhaust each ally you control. If no allies were exhausted this way, this card gains surge. Alter-Ego Action: Spend [mental][mental] resources → discard this card.
"I dare you to call me 'Peaches' again!" — Domino

card.name: One Step Ahead
card.property: When Revealed: Discard 1 random card from your hand (2 random cards instead if the villain has the [[AERIAL]] trait). If the villain is attacking, this attack gains overkill.

card.name: Stryfe
card.property: [star] While Stryfe is attacking you, he gets +X ATK, where X is the number of cards of the most common type in your hand.
"Kneel before your superior!"

card.name: Stryfe
card.property: [star] While Stryfe is attacking you, he gets +X ATK, where X is the number of cards of the most common type in your hand. When Revealed: Each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[PSIONIC]] attachment is discarded and reveals that card.

card.name: Stryfe
card.property: [star] While Stryfe is attacking you, he gets +X ATK, where X is the number of cards of the most common type in your hand. Forced Response: After you attack Stryfe, take X damage, where X is the number of cards of the most common type in your hand.

alternate.name: Uncontrollable Power
alternate.property: [star] Forced Response: After resolving step one of the villain phase, each player places X threat here, where X is the number of cards of the most common type in their hand. Each player may discard 1 card from their hand before calculating the value of X. If this stage is completed, the players lose the game.
Hope tries to mimic Stryfe's abilities, but is quickly overwhelmed by the power.

alternate.name: Left to Your Fate
alternate.property: Stryfe gains stalwart. Each identity gets +2 hand size. Increase the resource cost to play each player card by 1. If this stage is completed, the players lose the game.
Stryfe is attempting to escape into the past. Who knows what havoc he will wreak?

card.name: Stryfe's Grasp
card.property: Permanent. Hinder 6[per_hero]. Hope Summers can attack only Stryfe and can thwart only this scheme. Forced Response: After Stryfe is defeated or the last threat is removed from this scheme, flip this card and reveal Living Bomb. Place any threat here on Living Bomb.

alternate.name: Living Bomb
alternate.property: Victory 1. Stryfe cannot be defeated. When Revealed: Advance the main scheme to stage 2A. This effect cannot be canceled.
Mimicking Stryfe's power is too much for Hope to control and threatens to overwhelm her...with explosive results!

card.name: Mental Transferal
card.property: If Stryfe's Grasp is in play, attach to Hope Summers. Otherwise, attach to your identity. Forced Response: After Stryfe takes any amount of damage, attached character takes an equal amount of damage. Discard this card.

card.name: Mind Alteration
card.property: Attach to your identify. Forced Response: After you play an event or upgrade, take 1 damage. Response: After you recover, spend a [mental] resource → discard this card.

card.name: Mind Trap
card.property: Attach to your identify. Your allies, upgrades, and supports enter play exhausted. Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust 3 cards you control → discard this card.

card.name: Psionic Amnesia
card.property: Attach to your identify. Increase the resource cost of each ally and support you play by 2. Response: After you play an ally or support, exhaust your identity → discard this card.

card.name: Psychic Inertia
card.property: Attach to your identify. Hero Action: If your hero attacked and thwarted this phase → discard this card.
"It is...as if...something...is holding...Caliban back!" — Caliban

card.name: Zero
card.property: Guard. Patrol. Toughness. When Defeated: If the player who defeated Zero does not have at least 3 cards of the same type in their hand, shuffle Zero into the encounter deck.

card.name: Cerebral Erasure
card.property: When Revealed: Return an upgrade or support you control to its owner's hand. When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme returns an upgrade or support they control to its owner's hand.

card.name: Telepathic Camouflage
card.property: When Revealed: Each player places X threat here, where X is the number of cards of the most common type in their hand.

card.name: Psionic Surge
card.property: When Revealed: Discard the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is the number of cards of the most common type in your hand. Deal each [[PSIONIC]] card discarded this way to yourself as a facedown encounter card.

card.name: Psychic Override
card.property: When Revealed: Choose a card type, then discard each card from your hand that is not of that type. Draw up to your hand size. Place 1 threat on the main scheme for each card of the chosen type in your hand. Discard 1 card from your hand. Then, draw 1 card.

card.name: Telekinetic Wave
card.property: When Revealed: Return an upgrade or support you control to your hand. Stryfe activates against you. If you have at least 3 cards in your hand that share a type, place 3 threat on the main scheme.

card.name: Strobe
card.property: Patrol. When Revealed: Choose: • Stun each character you control. • Deal 1 damage to each character you control.

card.name: Tempo
card.property: While Tempo is engaged with you, you get +1 hand size. [star] Forced Response: After Tempo activates against you, discard cards from the top of your deck equal to twice the number of cards in your hand.

card.name: Thumbelina
card.property: Reduce the amount of damage Thumbelina takes from each attack by 1 unless the attacker has the [[TINY]] trait. When Revealed: Return the highest-cost upgrade you control to its owner's hand.

card.name: Wildside
card.property: When Revealed: Choose: • Wildside attacks you. • Return the highest-cost support you control to its owner's hand.

card.name: Extreme Measures
card.property: Hinder 2[per_hero]. Forced Response: After a player card enters play, its controller takes indirect damage equal to that card's printed cost.

card.name: Dragoness
card.property: [star] Forced Interrupt: When Dragoness activates against you, she gets +X SCH and +X ATK for that activation, where X is the number of [energy] resources in your hand.

card.name: Forearm
card.property: [star] Forced Response: After Forearm attacks you, discard X cards from the top of your deck, where X is the number of [physical] resources in your hand.
"They call me Forearm because I give good back rubs."

card.name: Reaper
card.property: [star] Forced Interrupt: When Reaper attacks you, if you have at least: • [mental][mental] resources in your hand, stun your identity. • [mental][mental][mental][mental] resources in your hand, exhaust your identity.

card.name: Samurai
card.property: [star] Forced Response: After Samarai attacks you, place 1 charge counter here. Choose: • Take damage equal to the number of charge counters on Samurai. • Discard 1 card you control with printed cost equal to or greater than the number of charge counters on Samurai.

card.name: Mutant Insurrection
card.property: Assault. (Basic thwarts against this scheme use ATK instead of THW.) Each minion gains toughness. When Revealed: Place 2 additional threat here for each [[MUTANT LIBERATION FRONT]] character in play. If no additional threat was placed this way, this card gains surge.

card.name: Lady Mastermind
card.property: Surge. When Revealed: Take X damage, where X is the printed cost of the event in your hand with the highest cost. Discard an event from your hand.

card.name: Malice
card.property: Surge. When Defeated: Attach Malice to the non-[[PSIONIC]] ally with the highest cost. Attached ally engages its controller. Threat attached ally as a [[POSSESSED]] minion with a blank text box (except for [[TRAITS]]). Attached minion's SCH is equal to its THW and it does not take consequential damage.

card.name: Scrambler
card.property: Surge. When Revealed: Discard an upgrade you control.
"Not so tough with your powers turned off, are you?"

card.name: Vanisher
card.property: Surge. When Revealed: Return the support you control with the highest cost to your hand. Return the support you control with the highest cost to your hand.

card.name: Under Pressure
card.property: Surge. Give the villain 1 additional boost card for this activation.

card.name: Overburdened
card.property: Surge. When Revealed: Choose to either discard 1 resource card from your hand or take 2 damage. Choose to either discard 1 resource card from your hand or take 2 damage.
